result.execSummary:
The defendant John Robert Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant John Robert Nelson in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16 CF 112, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepted Waiver, probable cause found, bound over.  Information filed, waived reading,  defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 in 15 CF 236, Ct. 1 in 15 CF 338, and Ct. 1 in 16 CF 112, Judgments to be entered.  15 CF 236, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3, 15 CF 338, Ct. 2 dismissed read in. 15 CF 236, Ct. 1 and 15 CF 338, Ct. 1 - Court withheld sentence, probation 3 years, 15 CF 236, 2 months jail w/Huber, jail start date 6/10/16 at 7:00 P.M., $618.00 costs, AODA and compliance absolute sobriety, DNA Sample, restitution to be held open for 90 days.  15 CF 338, $518.00 costs, AODA and compliance, absolute sobriety, DNA Sample.  16 CF 112 - Ct. 1, probation 3 years, 20 days jail w/Huber, consecutive, $518.00 costs, DNA Sample, absolute sobriety, AODA and comply.  Defendant to report to probation and parole by 4:00 P.M. today, 2 days sentence credit in 15 CF 338 and 2 days credit in 16 CF 112, bond to be applied.
plea and sentence at 04-18-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant John Robert Nelson in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF236 and 15CF338.  Recommendation given by State. Court advised it will not sentence defendant until a PSI is conducted.  Atty Davis requested a separate time for sentencing to allow DA Kohlwey to be present.  Court granted request.   Matter to be set for a separate plea/sentencing date.

Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
